original_table_html:
Brand Market share (%) Percentage volume accounted for by heaviest 20% of buyers
3 months 12 months
Sure 16 42 53
Lynx 14 41 53
Impulse 8 45 55
Rightguard 7 39 51
Dove 6 36 48
Tesco 4 43 53
Asda 3 42 54
Adidas 3 35 45
Gillette Series 3 39 50
Nivea 2 36 46
Natrel Plus 1 35 47
Mum 1 35 46
Average 39 50
summary_markdown: This data presents a comparative analysis of deodorant brands, detailing their market share and the concentration of purchasing volume among their heaviest 20% of buyers over two distinct periods: 3 months and 12 months. Brands are ranked by market share, with Sure leading at 16% and several brands sharing 1-3% at the lower end. For each brand, the percentage of total volume contributed by the top 20% of consumers is shown for both the 3-month and 12-month periods. For instance, Impulse, with an 8% market share, shows its heaviest buyers accounting for 45% of volume over 3 months and 55% over 12 months. The data also includes an overall average, indicating that across all brands, the heaviest 20% of buyers contribute 39% of volume over 3 months and 50% over 12 months, highlighting a general trend of increased purchasing concentration over longer timeframes.
